policies.name: Organizational Security Policy for CUI Protection
policies.description: High-level policy document addressing purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance for protecting CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.1 requires 'System security and privacy policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance'

procedures.name: Access Control Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all AC (Access Control) family requirements including account management, access enforcement, least privilege, and remote access controls
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires 'Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system security and privacy policy and the associated system security and privacy requirements' - AC family procedures

procedures.name: Audit and Accountability Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all AU (Audit and Accountability) family requirements including event logging, log review, and audit record protection
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - AU family procedures

procedures.name: Configuration Management Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all CM (Configuration Management) family requirements including baseline configuration, change control, and component inventory
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - CM family procedures

procedures.name: Identification and Authentication Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all IA (Identification and Authentication) family requirements including user authentication, MFA, and authenticator management
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - IA family procedures

procedures.name: Incident Response Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all IR (Incident Response) family requirements including incident handling, monitoring, reporting, and testing
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - IR family procedures

procedures.name: Maintenance Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all MA (Maintenance) family requirements including maintenance tools, nonlocal maintenance, and maintenance personnel controls
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - MA family procedures

procedures.name: Media Protection Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all MP (Media Protection) family requirements including media storage, sanitization, marking, and transport
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - MP family procedures

procedures.name: Physical Protection Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all PE (Physical Protection) family requirements including physical access controls, monitoring, and alternate work sites
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - PE family procedures

procedures.name: Personnel Security Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all PS (Personnel Security) family requirements including personnel screening, termination, and transfer processes
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - PS family procedures

procedures.name: Risk Assessment Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all RA (Risk Assessment) family requirements including risk assessment, vulnerability scanning, and risk response
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - RA family procedures

procedures.name: Security Assessment Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all CA (Security Assessment) family requirements including security assessments, POAMs, continuous monitoring, and information exchange
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - CA family procedures

procedures.name: System and Communications Protection Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all SC (System and Communications Protection) family requirements including boundary protection, transmission confidentiality, and cryptographic key management
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - SC family procedures

procedures.name: System and Information Integrity Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all SI (System and Information Integrity) family requirements including flaw remediation, malicious code protection, and system monitoring
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - SI family procedures

procedures.name: Planning Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all PL (Planning) family requirements including policy development, system security plan maintenance, and rules of behavior management
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - PL family procedures

procedures.name: System and Services Acquisition Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all SA (System and Services Acquisition) family requirements including security engineering principles, unsupported components, and external system services
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - SA family procedures

procedures.name: Supply Chain Risk Management Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all SR (Supply Chain Risk Management) family requirements including SCRM plan development, acquisition strategies, and supply chain requirements
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - SR family procedures

procedures.name: Awareness and Training Family Procedures
procedures.description: Step-by-step procedures for implementing all AT (Awareness and Training) family requirements including literacy training and role-based training
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a.2 requires procedures for each family of security requirements - AT family procedures

executionEvidence.name: Policy Review Meeting Minutes
executionEvidence.description: Annual meeting minutes showing: policies reviewed, participants present, changes identified, approval signatures, review completion date, next scheduled review date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.b requires 'Review and update policies [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]' - annual reviews are industry standard per NIST SP 800-12

executionEvidence.name: Procedure Review Records
executionEvidence.description: Annual procedure review records showing: procedures reviewed, changes made, testing of updated procedures, approval signatures, distribution records to personnel, review completion date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.b requires 'Review and update procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]' - annual reviews align with policy review cycles

executionEvidence.name: Policy Distribution Acknowledgments
executionEvidence.description: Acknowledgment records showing: policy name, version number, recipient name and role, acknowledgment date, signature or electronic confirmation, distribution method
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a requires 'disseminate to organizational personnel or roles' - acknowledgments prove dissemination occurred

executionEvidence.name: Policy Official Designation Letter
executionEvidence.description: Formal designation letter showing: official's name and title, scope of authority, responsibilities for policy/procedure development and management, signature of authorizing executive, designation date
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: N/A - maintained for duration of assignment
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.b requires 'Designate an organization-defined official to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination' - formal designation provides accountability

executionEvidence.name: Policy Compliance Assessment Reports
executionEvidence.description: Annual compliance assessment reports showing: policies assessed, implementation status, gaps identified, corrective actions required, responsible parties, completion timelines
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.01.a requires policies must 'address compliance' - periodic assessment validates compliance with established policies

operationalActivities: Develop and document organizational security policies for CUI protection
Create procedures for each of the 17 security control families
Designate official responsible for policy and procedure management
Disseminate policies and procedures to all personnel with CUI access
Collect and maintain acknowledgment records from personnel
Review and update policies annually or when significant events occur
Review and update procedures annually or when significant events occur
Ensure policies are consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, and regulations
Coordinate policy implementation across organizational entities
Maintain version control for all policies and procedures

policies.name: System Security Planning Policy
policies.description: Policy governing the development, maintenance, review, and protection of system security plans including requirements for plan content, update frequency, and distribution controls
policies.rationale: NIST 03.15.02 requires comprehensive SSP development and maintenance - policy provides governance framework for SSP lifecycle management

procedures.name: System Security Plan Development Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for creating new SSPs including: system component documentation, information type identification, threat modeling, security requirement mapping, safeguard documentation, and role assignment
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a requires 'Develop a system security plan' with 8 specific elements - procedure ensures consistent SSP development

procedures.name: System Security Plan Review and Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for conducting periodic SSP reviews including: review schedule, participants, change identification, approval workflow, version control, distribution of updated plans
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.b requires 'Review and update the system security plan [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]' - procedure ensures systematic reviews

procedures.name: System Security Plan Protection Procedure
procedures.description: Process for protecting SSPs from unauthorized disclosure including: classification marking, access controls, encryption requirements, secure storage, distribution tracking, and disposal procedures
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.c requires 'Protect the system security plan from unauthorized disclosure' - procedure implements protection controls

executionEvidence.name: Current System Security Plan
executionEvidence.description: Complete SSP document showing: constituent system components, information types processed/stored/transmitted, specific threats, operational environment and dependencies, security requirements overview, safeguards in place or planned, individuals with system roles, other relevant CUI protection information
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a requires SSP containing 8 specific elements - SSP itself is primary evidence of compliance

executionEvidence.name: System Security Plan Review Records
executionEvidence.description: Annual SSP review records showing: review date, reviewers present, sections reviewed, changes identified, changes implemented, approval signatures, next review date scheduled
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.b requires periodic review - annual reviews align with NIST SP 800-18 guidance for SSP maintenance

executionEvidence.name: System Security Plan Change Log
executionEvidence.description: Version control log showing: change date, sections modified, reason for change, approver name, version number, distribution date, personnel notified of changes
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.b requires updates - change log demonstrates SSP maintenance and version control

executionEvidence.name: System Security Plan Access Control Records
executionEvidence.description: Access logs showing: individuals granted SSP access, access justification/role, access grant date, access restrictions applied, periodic access reviews conducted, revoked access records
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.c requires protection from unauthorized disclosure - access logs demonstrate protection controls implementation

executionEvidence.name: System Component Inventory Reconciliation
executionEvidence.description: Quarterly reconciliation reports showing: components listed in SSP, components discovered in environment, discrepancies identified, SSP updates made, reconciliation completion date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a.1 requires SSP to 'Defines the constituent system components' - reconciliation ensures SSP accuracy

executionEvidence.name: Information Type Classification Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: CUI information types identified, systems processing each type, storage locations, transmission paths, classification rationale, data flow diagrams
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a.2 requires 'Identifies the information types processed, stored, and transmitted by the system' - classification records support SSP accuracy

executionEvidence.name: Threat Assessment Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Threat assessment reports showing: specific threats to the system, threat actors identified, attack vectors analyzed, threat likelihood ratings, impact assessments, organization concerns documented
executionEvidence.frequency: Annually or when threat landscape changes
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a.3 requires 'Describes specific threats to the system that are of concern to the organization' - threat assessment informs SSP content

executionEvidence.name: System Dependencies and Connections Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Network diagrams and documentation showing: operational environment description, dependencies on other systems, connections to external systems, trust relationships, system interconnections, data flows
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a.4 requires 'Describes the operational environment for the system and any dependencies on or connections to other systems or system components'

executionEvidence.name: Security Requirements Matrix
executionEvidence.description: Matrix document showing: overview of security requirements, applicable NIST controls, implementation status, safeguards in place or planned, control owners assigned, implementation timelines
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a.5-6 requires 'overview of the security requirements' and 'safeguards in place or planned for meeting the security requirements'

executionEvidence.name: System Roles and Responsibilities Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: individuals fulfilling system roles, role definitions, responsibilities assigned, contact information, backup personnel identified, role assignment dates
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.02.a.7 requires 'Identifies individuals that fulfill system roles and responsibilities' - personnel changes require frequent updates

operationalActivities: Develop comprehensive system security plan with all 8 required elements
Define and document all system components in the SSP
Identify and document all CUI information types in the SSP
Conduct threat assessments and document threats in the SSP
Document operational environment and system dependencies in the SSP
Map security requirements to implemented safeguards in the SSP
Assign and document individuals to system roles in the SSP
Review system security plan annually or more frequently as needed
Update SSP when system changes occur or during periodic reviews
Implement access controls to protect SSP from unauthorized disclosure
Maintain version control and change tracking for the SSP
Distribute SSP updates to appropriate personnel
Reconcile SSP content with actual system configuration quarterly
Integrate SSP with other security documentation and operational procedures

policies.name: Acceptable Use Policy
policies.description: Policy defining acceptable and unacceptable uses of organizational systems and CUI including responsibilities for protecting CUI, prohibited activities, personal use restrictions, and consequences of violations
policies.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.a requires 'Establish rules that describe the responsibilities and expected behavior for system usage and protecting CUI' - acceptable use policy provides these rules

procedures.name: Rules of Behavior Acknowledgment Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for providing rules to users and obtaining acknowledgments including: rules presentation method, acknowledgment collection process, record retention, enforcement for non-compliance
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.b-c requires providing rules and 'Receive a documented acknowledgement from individuals' before granting access - procedure ensures consistent implementation

procedures.name: Rules of Behavior Review and Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review and update of rules including: review schedule, stakeholders involved, change approval workflow, user notification process, re-acknowledgment requirements
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.d requires 'Review and update the rules of behavior [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]' - procedure ensures systematic reviews

executionEvidence.name: Current Rules of Behavior Document
executionEvidence.description: Complete rules document showing: user responsibilities for CUI protection, expected behavior for system usage, prohibited activities, security requirements by user role, differentiation between privileged and general user rules, consequences of violations
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.a requires establishing rules - the rules document itself is primary evidence of requirement establishment

executionEvidence.name: User Acknowledgment Records
executionEvidence.description: Signed acknowledgment forms or electronic confirmations showing: user name, user role, acknowledgment date, rules version acknowledged, signature or electronic acceptance, confirmation that user read and understands rules, agreement to abide by rules
executionEvidence.frequency: Upon hire, annually, and after rule updates
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.c requires 'Receive a documented acknowledgement from individuals indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior before authorizing access'

executionEvidence.name: Rules of Behavior Distribution Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: distribution date, distribution method (email, portal, orientation), recipients list, version distributed, distribution confirmation, follow-up for non-responders
executionEvidence.frequency: Upon hire, annually, and after updates
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.b requires 'Provide rules to individuals who require access to the system' - distribution records prove rules were provided

executionEvidence.name: Rules of Behavior Review Records
executionEvidence.description: Annual review records showing: review date, reviewers present, rules sections reviewed, changes identified, approval signatures, update implementation date, next scheduled review
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.d requires periodic review and update - annual reviews are industry standard for rules of behavior documents

executionEvidence.name: Access Enforcement Audit Logs
executionEvidence.description: System audit logs showing: access attempts before acknowledgment (blocked), access grants after acknowledgment confirmation, acknowledgment status verification in access control system, enforcement of acknowledgment requirement
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST 03.15.03.c requires acknowledgment 'before authorizing access to CUI and the system' - audit logs demonstrate enforcement of this requirement

executionEvidence.name: Role-Specific Rules Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: rules differentiation for privileged users, rules differentiation for general users, role-specific responsibilities, enhanced requirements for privileged access, CUI handling requirements by role
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion states 'Organizations consider rules of behavior for the handling of CUI based on individual user roles and responsibilities and differentiate between rules that apply to privileged users and rules that apply to general users'

executionEvidence.name: Rules Violation Incident Reports
executionEvidence.description: Incident reports showing: violation description, user involved, date of violation, investigation findings, disciplinary action taken, corrective measures implemented, prevention measures added to rules
executionEvidence.rationale: Violation records demonstrate that rules are enforced and serve as basis for rule improvements during reviews

operationalActivities: Establish comprehensive rules of behavior for system usage and CUI protection
Differentiate rules between privileged users and general users based on roles
Provide rules of behavior to all individuals requiring system access
Present rules during new hire orientation and onboarding
Collect documented acknowledgments from users before granting access
Verify acknowledgment completion before activating user accounts
Enforce technical controls to block access without current acknowledgment
Review and update rules of behavior annually
Notify users of rules changes and collect re-acknowledgments
Investigate and document rules of behavior violations
Track acknowledgment status in access control systems
Maintain acknowledgment records for audit purposes
Update rules based on new threats, incidents, or policy changes
